page.title: 02FARMING : A WEARDALE FARM(1)
page.content:
We have 2 farms which we run together. Weeds farm is at Westgate and Clough House farm is at Killhope. They are 8 miles apart. {Both are {sheep and cattle farms and neither {have ploughed land.
Weeds has better pastures and meadows than Killhope because the climate is warmer. At Killhope there is more meadow and pasture land but it is mainly moor. The land at Killhope is used mainly for sheep.
There are 520 sheep in the flock. They are Swaledale, Suffolk and Blue faced Leicesters. At Weeds the Leicester ram is crossed with a Swaledale ewe to breed a Mule lamb.
